DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is determine if topical oral application of a chlorhexidine antimicrobial spray will significantly reduce pneumonia and respiratory infections, and improve oral health compared to a placebo solution in nursing home residents.
DOC.brief_title: Chlorhexidine & Pneumonia in Nursing Home Residents
DOC.criteria: 1. Participants must be at least 65 years old. 2. Be dependent in 2 or more Activities of Daily Living as noted on the nursing home resident's Minimum Data Set One must be ADL J Personal Hygiene. 3. Have natural teeth and/or wear complete or partial dentures. 4. Expected to be a resident in a nursing home for two years. 1. Existing pneumonia. 2. History of chlorhexidine reaction or allergy and/or multiple medication or substance allergies. 3. Receiving chlorhexidine oral application at enrollment as prescribed by physician or dentist.
